title.narrative: OCHA: Social and Economic Reintegration of Excluded Children (CAAFAGs and GBV Survivors) in Bambo Health Zone, Rutshuru, North Kivu

description.narrative: This project aims to implement a package of social and economic reintegration activities for children and young people in a situation of exclusion in Bambo Health Zone, Rutshuru Territory, North Kivu. It aims to contribute to the reduction of social exclusion of children and young people associated with armed forces and groups and of survivors of sexual violence, by providing excluded children and young people (in particular CAAFAGs and GBV survivors) better access to social services, to community support, as well as to economic opportunities adapted to their needs and vulnerabilities. The project is built on a community-based approach which aims to strengthen local protection actors and other essential community-based structures to promote greater acceptance of excluded children within their communities. The project's protection activities will directly benefit 4,350 people, mostly children and young people, over 12 months. About 30,000 community members will also indirectly benefit from the project.
